intro: Eleocharis tetraquetra f. tetraquetra, commonly known as the common spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in temperate regions. The plant has slender, grass-like stems with spike-like inflorescences that bear small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, three-nerved spikelets. This species is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in wetland habitats.
